Salesforce Components - ThirdPartyRegistrationHandler
Overview    Classes    Enums    Interfaces    Triggers    SObjects    Groups    Index




Class ThirdPartyRegistrationHandler

global class ThirdPartyRegistrationHandler
implements Auth.RegistrationHandler

Registration handler for third-party authentication providers

Change History

06/23/2024 Initial version.

Members

  Modifiers and Type Name Description
global User
createUser(Id portalId, Auth.UserData userData)
Queries a user based on the third-party authentication data
global void
updateUser(Id userId, Id portalId, Auth.UserData userData)
Method to comply with the Auth.RegistrationHandler interface, not used

Methods

global User createUser(
  Id portalId,
  Auth.UserData userData
)

Implements/Overrides: Auth.RegistrationHandler.createUser(Id,Auth.UserData)

Queries a user based on the third-party authentication data

Parameters:
    portalId – Id: The portal Id, or null for standard Salesforce users
    userData – Auth.UserData: The user data as provided by the third-party authentication provider

Returns:
    User: The user that matches the third-party authentication data, or null if no match is found

global void updateUser(
  Id userId,
  Id portalId,
  Auth.UserData userData
)

Implements/Overrides: Auth.RegistrationHandler.updateUser(Id,Id,Auth.UserData)

Method to comply with the Auth.RegistrationHandler interface, not used

Parameters:
    userId – Id: The user Id
    portalId – Id: The portal Id
    userData – Auth.UserData: The user data as provided by the third-party authentication provider
